intro: Dryandra gilbertii, commonly known as the Gilbert's dryandra, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its unique, urn-shaped flowers that are typically pink or red in color. The plant has narrow, linear leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences. It is well adapted to the dry, sandy soils of its native habitat. Dryandra gilbertii is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens due to its striking floral display.
